title: Share of land area with unusually high annual precipitation
subtitle: Share of land area in the United States which experienced unusually high annual precipitation in a given year. Unusually high precipitation is measured based on the Standardized Precipitation Index (SPI) which compares actual yearly precipitation totals with the range of precipitation totals that one would typically expect at a specific location, based on historical data. Unusually high precipitation has a SPI value greater than 2.0.
sourceDesc: NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) via the US EPA
